more_info.origin: br/>Synthetic polymer.
more_info.dietary_restrictions: br/>None. E900 can be used by all religious groups, vegetarians and vegans.

more_info.origin: br/>Natural polymer produces by bees. The white wax is bleached by sunlight or hydrogen peroxide.
more_info.products: br/>Many different foods and pharmaceutical products.
more_info.dietary_restrictions: br/>None. E901 can be used by all religious groups, vegetarians, as it does not contain animals. The wax is an exudate of the bees and some vegans accept this product.

more_info.origin: br/>Natural polymer produced from the Mexican trees Euphorbia antisyphilitica , E. cerifera  and Pedilanthus pavonis .
more_info.dietary_restrictions: br/>None. E902 can be used by all religious groups, vegetarians and vegans.

more_info.origin: br/>Natural polymer produced from the Canauba palm (Copernica cerifera ) and related species from Brazil.
more_info.products: br/>Chewing gum, confectionary, coffee, bakery products
more_info.side_effects: br/>None known from use in foods. Canauba wax is widely used in cosmetics and can cause dermal eczema. People who have developed such eczema may be sensitive to the use of canauba wax in foods.
more_info.dietary_restrictions: br/>None. E903 can be used by all religious groups, vegetarians and vegans.

more_info.origin: br/>Natural polymer derived from certain species of lice from India .
more_info.dietary_restrictions: br/>None. E904 can be used by all religious groups and vegetarians. Vegans generally avoid the product as there are still lice in the raw product. These are eliminated during purification.

more_info.origin: br/>Synthetic mixture of hydrocarbons.
more_info.products: br/>Many different products, also in pharmaceutical and cosmetic preparations.
more_info.side_effects: br/>None known, but has laxative effects in high concentrations.
more_info.dietary_restrictions: br/>None. E905 can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin: br/>Natural polymer derived from trees from the genus Styrax  from Southeast Asia .
more_info.products: br/>Many different products, but mainly in pharmaceutical and cosmetic preparations (perfumes, make-up).
more_info.side_effects: br/>None known, but it often contains benzoic acid ().
more_info.dietary_restrictions: br/>None. 906 can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin: br/>Synthetic mixture of hydrocarbons.
more_info.products: br/>Many different products, also in pharmaceutical and cosmetic preparations.
more_info.side_effects: br/>None known, but has laxative effects in high concentrations.
more_info.dietary_restrictions: br/>None. E905 can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin: br/>Natural polymer derived from rice bran.
more_info.dietary_restrictions: br/>None. 908 can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin: br/>Wax obtained by solvent extraction of lignite (brown coal). It consists of non-glyceride carboxylic acid esters, free acids and resins.
more_info.dietary_restrictions: br/>None. E912 can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin: br/>A wax from sheep. It is excreted by the skin of the sheep and extracted from the wool.
more_info.products: br/>Chewing gum. Main use is in cosmetics.
more_info.dietary_restrictions: br/>None. 913 can be used by all religious groups and vegetarians, but not by vegans.

more_info.origin: br/>Resin obtained from the pine tree Pinus silvestris  and related species.
more_info.dietary_restrictions: br/>None. E915 can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin: br/>An essential amino acid, present in all protein (essential indicates that it is needed by the human body). Derived from proteins, including animal protein and hair.
more_info.dietary_restrictions: br/>None. E920 can be obtained from animal sources, including pork. It should thus be avoided by Muslims, Jews, Hindus and vegans.

more_info.origin: br/>An essential amino acid, present in all protein (essential indicates that it is needed by the human body). Derived from proteins, including animal protein and hair.
more_info.dietary_restrictions: br/>None. E921 can be obtained from animal sources, including pork. It should thus be avoided by Muslims, Jews, Hindus and vegans.

more_info.origin: br/>Produced from potassium metasulphate and hydrogen peroxide
more_info.dietary_restrictions: br/>None. 922 can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin: br/>Produced from ammonium metasulphate and hydrogen peroxide
more_info.dietary_restrictions: br/>None. 923 can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin: br/>Natural gas, obtained from salt.
more_info.dietary_restrictions: br/>None. 925 can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin: br/>Obtained from chlorine and sodium chlorite.
more_info.dietary_restrictions: br/>None. 926 can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin: br/>Obtained from carbonamide.
more_info.dietary_restrictions: br/>None. E927a can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin: br/>Obtained from ammonia and carbon dioxide.
more_info.dietary_restrictions: br/>None. E927b can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin: br/>Obtained from benzoylchloride and sodium peroxide.
more_info.dietary_restrictions: br/>None. 928 can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin: br/>Synthetic.
more_info.dietary_restrictions: br/>None. 930 can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin: br/>Natural inert gas.
more_info.dietary_restrictions: br/>None. E938 can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin: br/>Natural inert gas.
more_info.dietary_restrictions: br/>None. E939 can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin: br/>Synthetic inert gas.
more_info.products: br/>Canned and frozen products. Hardly used.
more_info.dietary_restrictions: br/>None. E940 can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin: br/>Natural inert gas.
more_info.dietary_restrictions: br/>None. E941 can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin: br/>Natural inert gas.
more_info.side_effects: br/>None known by use in foods.
more_info.dietary_restrictions: br/>None. E942 can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.side_effects: br/>None known by use in foods.
more_info.dietary_restrictions: br/>None. E943 can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.side_effects: br/>None known by use in foods.
more_info.dietary_restrictions: br/>None. E944 can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.dietary_restrictions: br/>None. E948 can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin: br/>Natural gas.
more_info.side_effects: br/>None known by use in foods.
more_info.dietary_restrictions: br/>None. E949 can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.

more_info.origin: br/>A synthetic carbohydrate alcohol, produced from milk sugar (lactose) derived from whey (milk).
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
Lactitol is partly absorbed and metabolised as glucose by the body; the remaining fraction is fermented in the large intestine. During fermentation, gases are produced, which may cause bloating and flatulence. In intolerant persons it can act as a laxative. Side effects normally occur after an intake of 25-30 grams in a single dose, which is far above the usage in normal foods.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
Lactitol can be used by all religious groups and vegetarians, but not by vegans, as the source is milk sugar. The term carbohydrate alcohol is a chemical definition; lactitol does not contain alcohol (ethanol).

more_info.origin: br/>A natural carbohydrate alcohol, present in many plants. It is commercially produced from xylan, a polysaccharide fraction of wood pulp.
more_info.side_effects:
/strong>
Xylitol is partly absorbed and metabolised as sugar by the body; the remaining fraction is fermented in the large intestine During fermentation, gases are produced, which may cause bloating and flatulence. In intolerant persons it can act as a laxative. Side effects normally occur after an intake of 25-30 grams in a single dose, which is far above the usage in normal foods.
more_info.dietary_restrictions:
/strong>
Xylitol can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians. The term carbohydrate alcohol is a chemical definition; xylitol does not contain alcohol (ethanol).
